channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Darren Aronofsky’s New AI Series About the Revolutionary War Looks Like Dogshit
item.description: "Used to be that when Darren Aronofsky wanted to feature a dead-eyed actor, he'd just employ Jared Leto."

item.title: Namecheap reveals the most popular TLDs of 2025 - and although an old favorite rules the roost, new AI challengers are coming
item.description: Domain name registrar unveils some interesting stats on the most popular TLDs of 2025.

item.title: The Best Moment in the Worst Episode of ‘Star Trek: Voyager,’ 30 Years Later
item.description: As 'Threshold' turns 30, there's still some potential in between all the weird space amphibian sex.

item.title: I've finally found the only gimbal I need — here's why the Hohem iSteady MT3 Pro is my go-to stabilizer for every camera I own
item.description: The Hohem iSteady MT3 Pro is a versatile gimbal that can stabilize most cameras, including phones, and offers some fantastic features.

item.title: Amazon discovered a 'high volume' of CSAM in its AI training data but isn't saying where it came from
item.description: The National Center for Missing and Exploited Children said it received more than 1 million reports of AI-related child sexual abuse material (CSAM) in 2025. The "vast majority" of that content was reported by Amazon, which found the material in its training data, according to an investigation by Bloomberg. In addition, Amazon said only that it obtained the inappropriate content from external sources used to train its AI services and claimed it could not provide any further details about where the CSAM came from. "This is really an outlier," Fallon McNulty, executive director of NCMEC’s CyberT...

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX, Tesla, and xAI in talks to merge, according to reports
item.description: This merger would bring the Grok chatbot, Starlink satellites, and SpaceX rockets together under one corporation.

item.title: 'AI is entering its next frontier... the foundation of the AI industrial revolution': Nvidia confirms CoreWeave will be among the first to get Vera Rubin chips as it doubles down on financial commitments
item.description: Nvidia expands its CoreWeave partnership with capital investment, early access to Vera Rubin, and deeper coordination on large-scale AI factory construction.

item.title: Napster Is Now a Slop Farm for AI Music
item.description: Now that's what I call slop! Vol. 2.

item.title: ‘Uncanny Valley’: Minneapolis Misinformation, TikTok’s New Owners, and Moltbot Hype
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, we dive into the news that's held our attention this week: ICE activity as it's been unfolding in Minnesota.

item.title: It’s a new heyday for gas thanks to data centers
item.description: The US is now leading a global surge in new gas power plants being built in large part to satisfy growing energy demand for data centers. And more gas means more planet-heating pollution. Gas-fired power generation in development globally rose by 31 percent in 2025. Almost a quarter of that added capacity is slated for […]

item.title: Amazon is reportedly in talks to invest $50B in OpenAI
item.description: If a deal materializes, it would mean Amazon is backing competing startups in the race for AI supremacy.

item.title: Bring the beach to work: I found 34 ocean-inspired upgrades that turn your home office into a seaside sanctuary
What Is the Future of ‘Dragon Ball’ Without Akira Toriyama?
item.description: Although the recently announced 'Dragon Ball Super: Galactic Patrol' is poised to adapt one of Goku's best arcs, 'Dragon Ball' without Akira Toriyama is gonna be weird to witness.

item.title: 130-inch TVs vs the projector: 2026's giant TV launches point to a new living-room battle
item.description: Choosing between a giant TV and a home theater projector is about to get a lot harder…

item.title: Mercedes-Benz Says the 2027 S-Class Gives Passengers a Better Ride Through AI
item.description: Updates to the vehicle of the financial district include things you can feel, including heated seat belts.

item.title: Apple just had a record-breaking iPhone quarter
item.description: Apple says the iPhone had its "best-ever" quarter, with revenue hitting more than $85.3 billion over the past few months. The company announced the news as part of its Q1 2026 earnings report, which also revealed record-breaking revenue of $143.8 billion, up 16 percent when compared to the same time last year. "The demand for […]

item.title: Medium gives employees Friday off to participate in national strike protesting ICE
item.description: Activists behind the general strike are calling for "no work, no school, and no shopping" amid a push to defund ICE, which has escalated raids in U.S. cities, killing several people, including two U.S. citizens earlier this month in Minneapolis.

item.title: Next-Generation Weather Satellite Captures Earth’s Atmospheric Chaos in Striking Detail
item.description: The first images from the European Space Agency’s MTG-S satellite offer an early look at how the mission will improve weather forecasting across Europe and Northern Africa.

item.title: Micron looks to help ease global chip crisis - new $24 billion Singapore facility should boost NAND supply worldwide, but will it be enough?
item.description: Micron’s $24 billion Singapore expansion aims to boost NAND supply, though long lead times will limit near-term impact on shortages.
